Class MainFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • MainFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class MainFrame
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Creates a 1024 x 720 pixel window with a menu in the menu bar.

    Version:
    V1.0.0, 10 June, 2014
    Author:
    Kenneth Tran

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainFrame

        public MainFrame()
        Constructs the JFrame Window with menus and menu items. Creates 6 buttons and an image contained in a Label on the JPanel. Upon clicking any of the buttons, or clicking the appropriate key bindings, the user will be brought to the screen of the button that they clicked. Also opens the high score file and reads in the data into an array.

        Parameters:
        quitItem - reference for JMenuItem, stores the menu item for 'quit'.
        fileMenu - reference for JMenu, stores the menu for 'file'.
        frameMenus - reference for JMenuBar, stores the menu bar which holds the menus. * @param image reference for JLabel, stores the label and ImageIcon of image that contains the title of the game.
        instructionsButton - reference for JButton, stores the button that will lead to the instructions and rules screen that the user may read to learn how the game and program works overall.
        lessonButton - reference for JButton, stores the button that will lead to the lesson screen where the user learns about lasers and optics.
        practiceButton - reference for JButton, stores the button that will allow the user to practice the game before playing the game.
        playButton - reference for JButton, stores the button that will allow the user to play the game (scores will be saved in this mode).
        highScoresButton - reference for JButton, stores the button that will lead to the high scores screen.
        quitButton - reference for JButton, stores the button that will exit the program.
        backgroung - reference for JLabel, used to store the image read in from a file to be used as the background of the main menu.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(HighScoreEntry[] toWrite)
        This method writes to and updates the high score file.

        Parameters:
        out - PrintWriter, refers to PrintWriter class used to read in from a file.
        ioe - IOException, reference to the thrown and caught IOException object.
        x - int, used in for loop.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Used as a general class of exceptions for failed or interrupted input operations

      • showGame

        public void showGame(int level,

        This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the game panel.

      • showLesson

        public void showLesson()
        This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the lesson panel.

      • showLevelSelect

        public void showLevelSelect(boolean isLive)
        This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the level select panel.
        Parameters:
        isLive - boolean to determine if the selected level is in practice mode (false), or an actual game (true)

      • showHighScores

        public void showHighScores()
        This method is used to hide the menu panel and show the high scores panel.

      • showMenu

        public void showMenu(char panel)
        The purpose of this static method is to be used by the classes of other panels to return to the menu.

      • aboutDialog

        public void aboutDialog()
        Displays a dialog which displays information about the game, the version, and the authors.
        Parameters:
        d - Reference for JDialog to display the dialog window
        game - JLabel which displays the logo of the game
        company - JLabel which displays the logo of the company
        title - JLabel which displays the title of the game
        team - JLabel which displays the company name
        programmers - JLabel which displays the names of the programmers
        version - JLabel which displays the current version of the game
        help - JLabel which displays contact information for help

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This method processes the user input based on what menu item is clicked and processes a response.

        Pressing the "Lesson" button will lead to the lesson panel, "Practice" will lead to a level selection screen for a practice mode, "Play" will lead to a level selection screen for a game, "High Scores" will display a high scores panel, "Quit" will close the window, "About" will display a JPanel about the authors, and "Help" will bring up a .chm help file.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - points to the ActionEvent class.
